reviews.review: Literally garbage game. Survivor based, the devs don't listen to others but survivors. Nerfing killers that dont even need the nerf, just because survivor mains cried like pus pus. I would never recommend the game to my friends, as long as the game is taht bad. Game is dying and the devs will notice it, but it would be too late. GG WP, had a blast playing it when everything wasnt survivor based.

DBD is mostly fun and a great game, especially with friends. Gameplay can be exciting and intense. The first 20 hours of the game is something you can never experience again. Being terrified at the start of a trial, anticipating what killer it is and getting jumped scared by Myers or Ghostface is a thrill. It can take awhile to really learn and understand the different aspects of the game, but once you start to, it becomes so much more fun. Learning how to loop the killer is so much fun, and anticipating what survivors are going to do as killer can be very satisfying. The fact that the in-game currency you earn can be used to purchase a lot of the content as far as new killers/survivors is an amazing system as well.

However some glaring issues exist
- The grind to unlock the perks from all the characters, and then get those perks on the character you want requires way more time than it should.
- Lack of communication from the DEVS
- The new MMR system promotes unhealthy/unfun playstyles at higher levels
- The game is balanced more towards newer players, which makes it frustrating for people with hundreds/thousands of hours
- It seems the like the game is caught half-way through being a "party" and a "competitive" game. I think a Ranked mode that is balanced differently would alleviate some issues


In conclusion, the game is a lot of fun and worth the price of the base game. I would play it for awhile before buying any/all of the DLC.

The MMR System is [b] killing [/b] the game.

Now your rank is worhtless and most of the matches you either absolutely destroy or get absolutely destroyed with no chance to win whatsoever (which, unfortunately, it's WAY more common than destroying the other side lol).

Giving it a thumbs up because it has the potential to be a nice, fun, CASUAL game, if they fix this damn MMR System that forces players to sweat and play at their peak every match no matter what rank they are. But i might change this review later on if this only gets worse.
